definitions.definition: a small area of still water, especially one that is artificial

examples.text: The Carters had a pond in their back yard.
The pond is drained every year.
The ponds are fully stocked with rainbow trout.
There are goldfish in the pond.
There were some ducks swimming on the pond.

phrases: the bottom, edge, middle, surface, etc. of a pond

examples.text: He's relatively unknown on this side of the pond.
Critics across the pond have been queuing up to heap praise on the movie.

definitions.definition: an important person (in a small community)

wordOrigin: Middle English: alteration of pound ‘a place where stray animals are kept’; commonly used in dialect in the same sense.
